title: 1998 FIFA World Cup Final
summary: The 1998 FIFA World Cup Final was the final match of the 1998 World Cup, the 16th edition of FIFA's competition for national football teams. The match was played at the Stade de France in Paris, France, on 12 July 1998, and was contested by Brazil and France. The tournament comprised France as the hosts, Brazil as the holders and 30 other teams who emerged from the qualification phase, organised by the six FIFA confederations.  The 32 teams competed in a group stage, from which 16 teams qualified for the knockout stage. En route to the final, Brazil finished first in Group A, with two wins and one defeat, after which they defeated Chile in the round of 16, Denmark in the quarter-finals and the Netherlands in a penalty shoot-out in the semi-finals. France finished top of Group C with three wins, before defeating Paraguay in the round of 16, Italy in the quarter-final, and Croatia in the semi-final. The final took place in front of 75,000 supporters, with an estimated 1.7Â billion watching on television, and was refereed by Said Belqola from Morocco.
